reviewText: I've wanted to read Cara Lockwood's novel for a while now but had not gotten the chance.  As I was flipping channels last night, I came upon this movie on Lifetime just as it was starting.  It was wonderful!  It did seem to have a similar plot as J-Lo's The Wedding Planner ... coincidentally, that was ALSO on TV last night at the same time.But having said that, it was a real cute movie, and there was an incredible chemistry between Denise Richards and Dean Cain. Dean Cain is adorable!  And I am really surprised Denise Richards is not more visible in the acting world. She really is quite good.I am so glad I came upon this movie on Lifetime last night!

reviewText: Yes, it is! It is similar to the movie "The Wedding Planner" with Jennifer Lopez. Though the script is similar, there are different aspects to the story which I really liked. The actors do a great job and the characters are as bright as wedding candles. Denise Richards carries off a fantastic performance as her character meets the man of her dreams in the midst of a run of confussion and pitfalls. These events spin around like the whirl of a tossed bouquet. The ending did not disappoint. Afterall, who doesn't love a happily-ever-after ending?
summary: IT IS OR IT ISN'T LIKE ANOTHER MOVIE?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I went into this movie with some trepidation, as I'd not really liked Denise Richards in anything previous. However, Richards is superb here, striking all the right notes and showing some very strong acting. Dean Cain is her attractive leading man and him and Richards have an appealing chemistry here. The story has enough plot twists to keep most people guessing, but in the end (SPOILER!) we all get the happy ending that we're were hoping for. And Snickers (the dog) just about steals the movie! I ended being very pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed this movie.

reviewText: I saw this movie on Australian TV a few months ago and loved it and knew I had to have it as part of my DVD collection.I have been a huge fan of Dean Cain since he was in Lois and Clark and have been following his career ever since.  I was never a real fan of Denise Richards until I saw her in this movie.  Both actors shine in their roles and you know they both had great fun making this movie.I recommend this to movie to anyone who is looking for a few hours of fun and and of course a happy ending...which is what we are all looking for.Order a copy of this DVD from Amazon today.

reviewText: A fun movie that starts slowly, builds speed, ends well and deals a few plot twists to keep you quessing.Denise Richards and Dean are fine as the two love interests that deal with mistaken identities, some crotchety, manipulative characters, and a cute actor dog.The story involves a junior wedding planner trying to get ahead with her demanding boss and get over a sour marriage- after a year and a half, she's still waiting for her cheating husband to sign the divorce papers.  Dean Cain is a charming, sweet(or is he?) fireman whom she reluctantly falls for.This is Lifetime and not Hallmark with some non-family friendly themes including a love scene, you get to see Dean's bare back, but still pretty mild by today's standards, but really there's no language, nudity or violence.

reviewText: Based on the novel by Cara Lockwood. A romantic comedy that follows divorced wedding planner Lauren Crandell (Denise Richards) as she meets the fireman of her dreams, Nick Corina (Dean Cain), at a disastrous wedding.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Denise Richards stars in this "Lifetime" original film as a wedding planner who is coming off a divorce, who suddenly falls for a hunky fireman, played by stud Dean Cain from TV's "New Adventures of Superman". The plot is pretty simple, the acting pure and innocent, and the film is geared to an audience who is attracted to romantic comedies. Who doesn't love a good film with beautiful people in the roles who fall madly in love, but then discover there are obstacles in their way of getting to the alter. "I Do (but I don't)" isn't filled with viloence, murders, or gore; it's a great romantic movie that will actually fill your heart while viewing it. I was never a huge fan of made-for-television films, but this one has a special place in my DVD library. The movie is widescreen and comes with deleted scenes and is 87 minutes long. Another great movie of Dean Cain's that is now a cult classic is "The Broken Hearts Club" where he plays an out gay actor living in West Hollywood.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a pretty good adaptation of Cara Lockwood's novel of the same name, although as any book to movie transition, a lot of left on the cutting room floor. But what is captured is the chemistry of the leads, Lauren and Nick, as well as the deviousness of the psycho-bride, Darla.Basically, it is the story of a harried wedding planner in the middle of a divorce who meets the fireman of her dreams, only to discover that he may be the groom in an upcoming wedding.Really charming and romantic!
summary: Good adaptation of a cute novel
Title: N/A
